column4: i cannot boot my pc(grub error and a god knows what else-non fixable-) is there any way to learn my email passwords stored in pigdin through live cd?
TheOneAndOnly:how?
yes, you can use the live cd and then mount the drive with your home directory on it, then find the .purple folder, which contains all your pidgin passwords
if you need any help with that, we're very happy to provide more specifics :)
probably i'll need it ...
sure.  first, boot the cd and tell us when you get there :)
unfortunately i dont have my pc with me right now....
how do i mount and which directory specific?
there should be some drives listed on the desktop, click on them until you find one that has a /home folder in it
click the home folder, then click your username
you'll have to enable hidden folders (press ctrl+h in the file browser) and then find the folder called .purple
and then (i am a bit newbe...)
then you'll want to find the file called accounts.xml
double click it, and you'll see a bunch of stuff -- I think you can probably figure out what your passwords are (they'll be in something like <password>mysupersecretpassword</password>
that should be it; if you have any more questions about it, feel free to ask :)
since you're on the livecd, you shouldn't
if you do for some reason though, you can run gksudo nautilus in the terminal, which will get you a root file browser
...and so the drive icons are the file manager...and since i find the accounts.xml i just "find" the word password.but won't they be encrypted or something?
they can't be encrypted, otherwise you'd have to type a password in every time you wanted to login to your accounts
...propably so it just works like a common text file,no other worries?
yep
if you find the file, you're all set
you are a life savor thnx!
good luck and hope that works for you :)
